Package com.eddy.docker

Class DockerSandbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eddy.docker.DockerSandbox
  • public final class DockerSandbox
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides an "API" to abstract the classes of this module into an easy to use interface to allow commands to be run in sandboxed docker containers. An example of compiling and running a c++ program is seen here: (A gcc_compile and gcc_run profile is set up with a GCC image, with compile using user root and run using user sandbox. Our working directory is /home/sandbox) 
    
     DockerSandbox.configure("profiles.json"); // or DockerSandbox.configure(Docker.Shell.BASH, gcc_compile, gcc_run)
     // add environment variables with DockerSandbox.addEnvironmentVariables("VAR1=VALUE", "VAR2=VALUE");
     // add bindings:
     //   Docker.Bindings bindings = new Docker.Bindings();
     //   bindings.add("/path/to/host:/path/to/remote");
     DockerSandbox.start()

     Docker.Command compile_command = new Docker.Command("gcc main.c -o main");
     Result compile =
          DockerSandbox.run("gcc_compile", compile_command, new WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile("main.c", "/path/to/main.c"));

     Docker.Command run_command = new Docker.Command("./main");
     Result run =
          DockerSandbox.run("gcc_run", run_command); // notice that this run command will be able to access the compiled main.c from the previous command

     To pass stdin in, you can either pass the String or a File in to use a File for stdin.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public static void configure​(Docker.Shell shell,
                             Profile... profiles)
        Configure the system (and the Docker client) using the provided shell and profiles. See Docker(Docker.Shell) and Docker.addProfiles(Profile...) for how it is configured using this method
        Parameters:
        shell - the shell the docker containers should use
        profiles - the profiles to be loaded in

      • configure

        public static void configure​(java.lang.String JSONFile)
        Configures the system (and the Docker client) using the JSON file. See Docker(String) for info on JSON configuration
        Parameters:
        JSONFile - the path to the JSON file to load profiles from

      • addEnvironmentVariables

        public static void addEnvironmentVariables​(java.lang.String... envs)
        Add environment variables to be shared between each run call. They are specified in the form VARIABLE=VALUE.
        Parameters:
        envs - the list of environment variables to add

      • setBindings

        public static void setBindings​(Docker.Bindings bindings)
        The bindings to use for each run call
        Parameters:
        bindings - set of bindings to use for run calls

      • run

        public static Result run​(java.lang.String profile,
                         Docker.Command command,
                         WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile... uploadedFiles)
        Run the command with the specified profile, command and uploaded files with no stdin. See run(String, Docker.Command, String, WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile...)
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile to use
        command - the command to execute
        uploadedFiles - the files to upload to the working directory if any
        Returns:
        the result of the run call

      • run

        public static Result run​(java.lang.String profile,
                         Docker.Command command,
                         java.io.File stdin,
                         WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile... uploadedFiles)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Run the command with the specified profile, command and uploaded files with a file as stdin. See run(String, Docker.Command, String, WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile...)
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile to use
        command - the command to execute
        stdin - the file to read the contents from and use as stdin
        uploadedFiles - the files to upload to the working directory if any
        Returns:
        the result of the run call
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • run

        public static Result run​(java.lang.String profile,
                         Docker.Command command,
                         java.lang.String stdin,
                         WorkingDirectory.UploadedFile... uploadedFiles)
        Run the command with the specified profile, command and uploaded files with String stdin. configure(com.eddy.docker.Docker.Shell, Profile...) or configure(String) and start(String) needs to be called first or else an IllegalStateException will be thrown
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile to use
        command - the command to execute
        stdin - the standard input String to send to the docker container
        uploadedFiles - the files to upload to the working directory if any
        Returns:
        the result of the run call

      • start

        public static void start​(java.lang.String workingDirectory)
        Starts the system and readies it for calls to run. This call should have a subsequent call to finish() after you are finished with the run calls to ensure that resources are released
        Parameters:
        workingDirectory - the path of the working directory on the docker container

      • finish

        public static void finish()
        Finishes the system by releasing any resources and resetting this class. The configure and start methods will need to be called again after this call

      • getWorkingDirectory

        protected static WorkingDirectory getWorkingDirectory()
        Retrieve the working directory object being used
        Returns:
        working directory

      • getBindings

        protected static Docker.Bindings getBindings()
        Retrieve the bindings being used
        Returns:
        bindings

      • getDocker

        protected static Docker getDocker()
        Get the docker client being used
        Returns:
        docker client

      • getEnvs

        protected static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getEnvs()
        Get the list of environment variables being used
        Returns:
        list of environment variables

      • onException

        public static void onException()
        This method should be called in a catch block to ensure that any created containers left behind by a run call (which may have thrown the exception) are removed to avoid name conflict exceptions
